cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Caibarien, Cuba / 275 mi SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn NW late Saturday, cross the Florida Keys early Sunday, move up the Florida peninsula, then track inland across southwest Georgia and into Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys and the southwest Florida coast near Naples/Marco Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of the Volusia/Brevard County line FL northward to Fernandina Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning and Storm-Surge Warning currently confined to the Florida peninsula and Keys, not yet extended to Georgia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina expected to feel impacts
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (64% peak probability) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; 31% chance of sustained 50-kt winds with possible hurricane-force gusts as the center passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large wind field and long onshore fetch could drive 3–5 ft of surge along the Georgia coast, especially near inlets and the Marshes of Glynn.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain possible across southeast Georgia, producing dangerous flash flooding around Brunswick and low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip-currents will pose additional operational hazards.
